intro: Prainea limpato subsp. papuana, commonly known as the Papuan prainea, is a species of flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Prainea limpato subsp. papuana is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations.
